website_summaries.verdict: If you're in the market for a high-end iced tea maker that delivers on its promises, this would be the one to consider.
pros: Higher capacity carafe, and a number of brewing options not offered by other makers
We found this iced tea maker worked well with all different types of teas
cons: Definitely on the pricier end of the iced tea maker market
For the price, we expected to find fewer customer concerns about noise and brew quality

customer_reviews.title: Glad to have found it.
customer_reviews.text: Best iced tea maker, I had used mine for maybe 20 years. It was starting to sputter, so I ordered this used one. I glued my old one while waiting for this to arrive, and it is now working ok...but I will keep this one in reserve. Too bad they don't make new ones like it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: bkbh

customer_reviews.title: Great tea every time!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second. The first one lasted 20 years. Easy to use. Makes consistently great Tea.
customer_reviews.author: gejnpa

customer_reviews.title: Salton Tea Maker
customer_reviews.text: This tea maker makes delicous tea. The unit is light-weight and the price was great. Our only complaint with it is the security of the basket (filter/teabag holder). Even though I lock it as it says, if I don't position the pitcher just right under the basket where the spring is, the basket can fill with tea and overflow. I usually have to check it and move it as necessary and even re-lock the basket to prevent this from happening.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Jo

customer_reviews.title: mdp Salton tea maker review
customer_reviews.text: Tea maker is a bit smaller than other products but I find it brews a nice pot of tea in a reasonable amount of time with little to no messy dripping. Since the container is small, the te tends to be a little stronger than expected when using 2 family size tea bags. Overall this is a good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Beattie

customer_reviews.title: The Best One on the Market!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried them all. This is the best one. It takes up the least amount of space and the design is excellent. I use one large tea bag, brew the tea, and then fill up the rest of the container with water instead of ice. I put it in the refrigerator and when it gets cold, I have the perfect glass of iced tea.
customer_reviews.author: George Moniker

customer_reviews.title: better than the Mr. Coffee Tea Maker
customer_reviews.text: I have owned two Mr. Coffee Tea Makers and they worked well but the pitchers always crack. This one is much better because the tea does not run down the side and crack the plastic pitcher. It drips in the middle so the heat won't hurt the container. I have only used it a few times but it works good. The only reason I didn't give it five stars was due to the size of the pitcher. It is a little small and the lid has a whole in the top so if it were to sit in the refrigerator for a couple of days the tea might pick up the taste or smell of other things.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Durable product
customer_reviews.text: We have had our Sultan icetea maker for about twelve years. It was given to us as a Christmas gift. We have had to replace the pitcher once because it was damaged, but over all performance has been very satisfactory. We have recommended it to others over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Charles De Vito Jr.

customer_reviews.title: I like the product
customer_reviews.text: I like the product. It is what I was looking for. I was surprised to pay you almost $50 for this product and then find a price tag on the delivered product dated 11/22/14 which said the price was $7.99
customer_reviews.author: Robert Malzahn

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons of this Purchase
customer_reviews.text: It is small and compact I like the design and features that's why I purchased it as a gift. It is a little smaller than I prefer actually and the overflow problem was very messy I was going to send it back or throw it agains a wall then the spring popped out. Now it works no overflow problem it fits better into the basem so if you have this and are having the problems listed in the reviews and like a smaller compact teapot this one works great once you remove that spring. Or it pops out whichever comes first.
customer_reviews.author: Diana W

customer_reviews.title: Best Ice Tea Maker
customer_reviews.text: Received the same Ice Tea maker for our wedding 25 yrs ago-wore it out-could never find another I liked-tea just didn't taste as good. Found this one by accident and jumped on it!
customer_reviews.author: Darrelyn Dutcher-Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for me
customer_reviews.text: This brews tea as it describes. It's not noisy, it's not difficult to clean (by hand, not dishwasher safe - as stated in the manual), and it's does stop dripping when you remove the pitcher (you must wait for at least two cups to brew before you remove pitcher, as the manual states). As stated by someone else, it is a bit small, but then again, I only make iced tea for me. To make a gallon I need to brew two batches, which I then pour into a gallon jug and fill with water. Overall I'd have to say it is a very good value. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Redbeard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I love the iced tea and iced coffee that I can make with this machine. It's very easy. I would have preferred if it made cold brewed iced coffee; it does not,it's a hot brew machine. But I'm very pleased with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Capricorn

customer_reviews.title: What A Great Little Machine!
customer_reviews.text: I just love this iced tea maker. I still can't believe I only paid $11.99 for it. It makes perfect tea in under 10 minutes. It runs quietly and makes no more noise than a coffee maker does. It makes enough tea for 1 or 2 people for 1 day. It's just a great little appliance to add to your kitchen, no more no less.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle R. Motto

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad But Prefer Electric Kettle & Teapot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace one destroyed in a kitchen fire. I guess it's convenient for families of 4 or more, but or me, it's easier and faster to heat water in my electric kettle (16 years old), then steep the tea in a larger pitcher or in teapots or in individual cups. The other advantage of using tea pots or cups instead of the iced tea maker is that everyone can choose his/her own tea. Some people want decaf, others want regular. Some want Earl Grey while others want Constant Comment, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Neschie Smith

customer_reviews.title: I love this product!
customer_reviews.text: This little tea maker is great. I have not had any problems as described by one reviewer. The internal parts are removeable and can be safely washed in the dishwasher. It is a little small, but I run two batches of water through using the same tea bags and fill up a one gallon jug. My only recommendation for the manufacturer is to make the caraf out of glass and not plastic. It would have been 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in DFW

customer_reviews.title: Ice Tea Maker
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these tea makers a few years ago. I had it for probably 5 years. When it finally quit working I bought the Mr Coffee Ice Tea Maker and I have been through 2 of those in the last year and a half. This is a great product and I won't be buying a Mr Coffee again.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Heath

customer_reviews.title: great tea maker
customer_reviews.text: so far this has been the best tea maker that i've used and i make a lot of tea. I wouls recomend this product
customer_reviews.author: Roger Newman

customer_reviews.title: I paid $10 for this wonderful ice tea maker!
customer_reviews.text: About 20 years ago in a discount kitchen goods store at the Jersey shore! It still works well (although went through a period of about 10 years when it was packed away and never used), but last few times I made pitchers of mint tea, it occasionally made my stomach queasy. Thought perhaps there were too many uncleanable parts, and two removable filters were horribly stained, and was time for a replacement. Imagine my shock when saw this simple little plastic machine on sale for $159!! Wow! It’s a great model, and, for me, incredibly long-lasting and reliable, but could never justify that price point for a new one. Too bad it can’t be purchased for a reasonable amount.
customer_reviews.author: Annandale

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: A friend purchased one for my wife and I (really just me, because she doesn't drink tea) for our wedding over 17 YEARS ago. I've use it about 4-6 times a week almost that entire time. It has worked fantastic and still does. I really would never have thought a $25 (guessing) appliance would have done so well. The 2 interlocking plastic pieces that you put the tea bags in, seem to stain from the tea easier in the last few years but it's really not a problem. I just soak them in a water and oxygenated bleach powder solution for a few minutes and they come back to T-Shirt white.
customer_reviews.author: S8GotGrip

customer_reviews.title: Used everyday for years, it works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've used mine everyday for at least 6-7 years, and it works great everytime. I just fill to the water line, put in 3 Lipton "family" size tea bags, and press the button. I never bother with putting ice in it, I just put it in the refrigerator and in a few hours its cold. It lasts two of us a couple of days. My mother has the same unit and we were commenting the other day that it's the single most used appliance in the house. Perfect tea, every time and couldn't be simpler.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: 500 + gallons a year
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. I have used mine for almost 10 years and brew 10+ gallons a week
customer_reviews.author: Mike Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product so much I have purchased them more than once for myself and for friends :) My husband and I drink ice coffee every day of the year so I would say in an average year I use this machine 350 days. You can adjust the strength of the coffee which I love and even the flarored coffee works really well not watered down. This machine is easy to use and cleans easily as well. I would recommend this product to anyone who is a fan of ice coffee. It rocks!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy L. Lichtenstein

customer_reviews.title: The Best Has Arrived!
customer_reviews.text: You know the saying, "the best is yet to come"? Well, ours finally arrived! We love our new Salton Tea Maker! It is so much nicer to have the pitcher sit within the tea maker rather than pushed up next to it like so many of the others we have tried, and we have tried quite a few over the years. Tea always managed to leak out onto our countertop whenever we used those...not so with this one! My only wish is that it would be available in a 3 liter size as we have 5 tea lovers in our home and we make quite a bit of tea as you can imagine. Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Machine!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is so easy to use. Brewing a pitcher of iced tea or iced coffee takes less than 15 minutes. Cleanup is simple, too. All parts fit together easily, and can be quickly rinsed and/or washed. The trickiest part is making sure that the filter basket is turned correctly for brewing tea--the small hole in the bottom of the basket fits over the plug in the basket-holder. The drawing in the manual was of no help on this; one has to read the directions while manipulating the parts, and then it makes sense. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Becky Trewartha

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Although it is only 2 liters, this iced tea maker is great! I love the fact that it works like a coffee maker and drips into the top center of the pitcher. I have had so many problems with leaking with the other style makers, since you only insert the pour spout into the maker, that it's great not to have to worry about that. I also love the idea that it only takes up the same amount of counter space as a coffee maker, and you don't need extra space for the pitcher sitting in front of it. Over-all, I think the positives really outway the negatives on this one!
customer_reviews.author: L. Michael Yandura

customer_reviews.title: acceptable, not terrific
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, with a couple of caveats. 1) tea builds up and gets pretty grungy and hard to remove, and the surfaces are not easy to get at to scrub 2) sometimes the drip hole gets clogged or mis-aligned, and the tea doesn't drip into the pitcher, instead it overflows in the top This is the 1st tea maker I've owned. I use it most every day. Next time I buy one, I might just buy a coffee maker instead. I don't see a difference.
customer_reviews.author: validnode

customer_reviews.title: I love it !!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought me this ice coffee/ice tea maker over 10 years ago. I make iced coffee 2-3 times a week and I have never had a problem with it! It is delicious and MUCH cheaper than a morning dunkin donuts run. All of the parts are removeable for easy cleaning in your dishwasher, a big plus for me! I have enjoyed this product so much I am considering buying another one just in case mine ever breaks and it is no longer available. This is a product I am happy to recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rozanne Silva

customer_reviews.title: Never Worked
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tea maker to replace an old tea maker that was stained so badly I was embarrassed to have it on my counter, but it still worked. The look of the Salton was very similar and after looking in every store for a replacement, I was happy to find the Salton on line. However, I have not been able to enjoy the first cup of tea because the thing never worked. The switch does not go on to brew a pot of anything. Thank goodness it was only $11.99.
customer_reviews.author: V. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: After lots of research, I found this to be the top recommended ice tea maker. It works wonderfully. No cracks (so far) in the pitcher and because it works like a coffee maker, it drips straight down into the pitcher with no mess. The Mr. Coffee maker really needs to improve their design if they want to outbeat this competition. We love it so much and use it twice daily, that we are going to buy another as back up for the summer. Don't hesitate....the Salton Ice Tea Maker is great!
customer_reviews.author: Moonmaiden268

customer_reviews.title: This is Great
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I have owned. We wore the first one out after about five years. we used it every day, I'm from Texas and we drink alot of iced tea. This works just like a coffee maker and works great. It allows you to pull it out and pour a glass while its still brewing. I love this thing
customer_reviews.author: KF

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: first review i've ever written and i'm only writting because this is a great product. Despite what other users have said I have never had an "overflow problem", and i have had this for YEARS (i'm talking like 10 years). And cleaning it is not a problem because the cups with the "ridges" are removeable and can either be put in the dishwasher or hand washed in the sink. I think it's a great product and definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: opinionated

customer_reviews.title: Ice tea maker The best
customer_reviews.text: I love the Salton ice tea maker I searched for it on here because i had one before and it lasted 9 years .It is very easy to use ,takes up a much smaller space then the MR Coffee one.I like it because the pitcher fits right under the unit .Not like the other brands that only the pour spout fits under.In no time at all you have a nice fresh brewed pot of ice tea.I recommend it very highly.Also it was shipped much faster then i expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kathrine Mcmillan

customer_reviews.title: love my Salton Iced Tea Maker
customer_reviews.text: I have used this Salton Iced Tea maker for years - when if finally needed to be replaced I wanted only to buy the Salton Iced Tea Maker. It makes great tea - easy to use. I like it much better than other brands I've tried. Amazon got me the best price for my beloved iced tea maker for sure!
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Schenck

customer_reviews.title: Salton Ice Tea Maker
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty satisfied with this product. It makes very good tea. My only complaint is a part that was missing from the brew basket. The part was the spring that allows you to remove the pitcher during the brew process. The spring shuts the valve preventing the tea from dripping out when the pitcher is removed. Otherwise, this is a very good product. Bill P.S. I was able to find a spring to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bcar

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love this tea maker!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have this tea maker under the brand Westinghouse. I use it all the time and was looking for another to have in case it stops working. Couldn't find it until I came across the Salton brand which was excactly like the one I have. I use it everyday for tea, Herb tea,green tea, and ice coffee. I encourage anyone to purchase one and use it. No more sun tea. I use my Salton tea maker!!!! Happy customer!!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly A. Bax

customer_reviews.title: Makes great tea
customer_reviews.text: I have used a Salton ice tea maker for 10 years or more and it makes great ice tea. The tea is much better tasting than Mr. Coffee. I use coffee filters to keep the basket clean. The one I have does stop the flow of tea when you remove it. I would reccommend this to anyone it is easy to use and makes 2 quarts of tea in about 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't live without it.
customer_reviews.text: I have had my tea maker for 6 years and use it all the time. I have used other tea makers at my Mom's and she has went through 3 to my one. I rec'd it as a wedding gift so I have been looking for one for my Mom. I only wish they made it in a larger size. I usually make it strong enough for 4 quarts and just pour it over into my larger pitcher. Love, Love, Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy for WV

customer_reviews.title: Not as bad as some of the reviews on this board
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about 1 month now and have not had any problems with it. Maybe my expectations were not as high as some other posters. It does what it states and make some great tasting ice tea. Plus at the new price of $11.00 its definately a steal especially if you are buying something else you might be eligible for the free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: jeffro

customer_reviews.title: Salton KM44WHT 2-Liter Iced Tea Maker, White
customer_reviews.text: This Salton has a practical design and makes tea well. I love this ice tea maker because of it works well :-))) and doesn't leak water all over the counter:-(((( like other brands I've tried. My only "wish" is that it would come with an extra/spare ice tea pitcher.
customer_reviews.author: T C

customer_reviews.title: I loved the one I had
customer_reviews.text: I loved the one I had. It worked very well for five years and finally quit due to me not keeping up with cleaning the mineral buidup out of it regularly (we have very hard water). The price listed is ridiculous though. We paid less than $30 for ours at a retailer.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle D. Moe

customer_reviews.title: Where, oh where, has my iced tea gone?
customer_reviews.text: We have this iced tea maker in use daily at our house! Guests and family rave about "my" iced tea. This quick tea maker is always available to make another fresh brewed batch, ready to serve.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Minard

customer_reviews.title: Works Good
customer_reviews.text: It is a little cheap looking but it does the job. I'm not sure how long it will last. But for know it works really well, however, if you don't set it up just right it will overflow.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Sousa

customer_reviews.title: Salton  Ice Tea Maker
customer_reviews.text: The machine works beautifully and it was a bargain at the Amazon price. I would highly recommend to anyone and it works much better than the Mr. Coffee iced tea maker that I had for many years.
customer_reviews.author: David N. Morse

customer_reviews.title: SALTON ICE MAKER
customer_reviews.text: The Salton Ice Tea/Ice Coffee maker performs as advertized. The two liter size is a little smaller than I would like, but for the price, it is a good addition to the beverage center.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Fromson

customer_reviews.title: Salton tea maker
customer_reviews.text: We love it. Now the tea does't run everywhere but in the pitcer. It's smaller than the other one, but that's ok.
customer_reviews.author: Linda E. Gamble

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ICE TEA  MAKER
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY LIKE THIS ICE TEA MAKER....SO MUCH I BOUGHT ONE FOR A GIFT AND SHE LIKES IT TOO!
customer_reviews.author: T GAL

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I HAD AN OLD TEA MAKER AND NEEDED A NEW ONE THIS ISN'T THE SAME BRAND BUT IT WORKS GREAT AND BETTER THAN THE ONE I HAD BEFORE
customer_reviews.author: ELAINA ZABA

customer_reviews.title: A great value at $11.99
customer_reviews.text: Like several other reviewers noted on the Mr. Coffee Iced Tea Maker, the pitcher cracked after a couple years use. Since the replacement pitcher was the same price as this, I decided to try it. It is small, but perfect for 1-2 people. It was not noisy and made perfect tea in about 10 minutes, maybe less time. The only drawback is it does not permit strenght adjustment, so I only gave it four stars. For the price, it's a great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Salton KM44 - Pitcher cracks in dishwasher with heated dryer
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Salton KM44 tea maker for several years and have liked it. It works great and is quick to brew. I like also that I can choose to make both coffee or iced tea. The only drawback I have had is that the pitcher doesnt like the dishwasher dryer. It deforms and cracks with the DW dryer on. I have replaced it once and since have forgotten and ruined the second pitcher. It still receives the lid, but very tight and the pouring spout is cracked so it leaks. I am ready to buy a new replacement pitcher and would hope by now they are making new ones to be dishwasher proof. -RSP
customer_reviews.author: R. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Used this for many many years
customer_reviews.text: I've used this iced tea maker for many years...I'm on my third machine. It makes terrific iced tea from loose tea with minimal effort. I use it every day, winter and summer, and have found it very reliable. I tried the Mr. Coffee ice tea maker once a few years ago, but that was difficult to use and often ended up spilling ice tea over the whole counter. I suggest bleaching the basket and the unit with Clorox Kleenup spray every few weeks to keep it clean.
customer_reviews.author: carolann

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite Ice Tea Maker!
customer_reviews.text: A friend had this ice tea maker a good six years ago. I found one like it under another brand name in a discount store, and after three years, it's still making the best ice tea around! Found this one on Amazon, new brand name, but same ice tea maker. Seven Luzzaine Tea bags, 3/4 cup of Splenda and you've got the best brewed ice tea around. Easy to clean, take the filters out and throw them and the carafe in the dishwasher! I just ordered FIVE for Christmas presents!
customer_reviews.author: M. Burns

customer_reviews.title: I Wish This Iced Tea Maker Was Still Available
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Salton Iced Tea Maker a few years ago and use it daily without any problems. It produces a consistently excellent pitcher of iced tea within a few minutes. I want to purchase another one for my office, but it is unavailable (even on the Salton website). Please inform me when it comes back on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Salton Ice Tea Maker is a good buy
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with how quickly it makes tea and the tea maker itself seems well made. I have been using it a few months and so far I have no real complaints. I do wish the tea pitcher had been make a litte sturdier. I am trying this brand because I kept having problems with the pitcher cracking on the Mr. Coffee Ice Tea Maker.
customer_reviews.author: J. Crump

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TEA MAKER!
customer_reviews.text: It worked great.The only improvement would be to make it in a three quart size.It has a much better quality pitcher than the Mr. Coffee brand.
customer_reviews.author: Willie E. Stump

customer_reviews.title: Quick shipping, and excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item qualifying for the free shipping. I received the item in five days. Like a kid with a new toy I quickly made some ice tea...delish! Thanks, Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas F. Mcdonough

product_meta.title: Salton 2-Liter Iced Tea Maker, White
product_meta.description:
2-Liter Iced Tea Maker, White by Salton

AMAZON.COM
Salton's iced tea maker is a wonderful addition to the kitchen on hot summer days when you want to make instant iced drinks for family and friends. It features a water level indicator for easy measuring and turns off automatically. With its white housing and clear plastic carafe, it looks attractive on the counter, and it comes with a handy pitcher to serve guests, whether they are in the living room playing charades or in the garden admiring roses. --Julie McCowan
feature_bullets: Countertop appliance makes 2 liters of iced tea or iced coffee
Shatter-resistant carafe with sturdy handle for easy serving
Water-level indicator; automatic shut-off provides added safety
Includes a carafe, lid, and removable filters
Measures 13 by 8 by 7-1/2 inches; 1-year limited warranty
